title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper. It’s rich, creamy, and incredibly satisfying.
instructions: 1. Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions in salted water until al dente.
2. In a large pan, cook the pancetta or bacon over medium heat until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
3. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan, Pecorino, and a generous amount of black pepper.
4. Once the pasta is cooked, reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water and then drain.
5. Add the hot pasta to the pan with pancetta and toss to combine.

6. Quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, tossing vigorously to coat the pasta in the creamy sauce. If it’s too thick, add reserved pasta water a little at a time to reach desired consistency.
7. Serve immediately with extra Parmesan and black pepper on top.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato-based gravy. A perfect balance of spices and richness.
instructions: 1. In a large bowl, marinate the chicken with a pinch of salt, half of the garam masala, and 1 tbsp of oil. Let it sit for at least 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a large pan or skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté for 5 minutes, until softened.
3. Add garlic and ginger, and cook for another minute until fragrant.
4. Stir in the remaining spices: garam masala, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
5. Add the chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, and sugar. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. While the sauce simmers, grill or cook the marinated chicken pieces in a separate pan until golden brown and cooked through.
7. Once the sauce is thickened, add the grilled chicken to the pan and stir in the cream. Simmer for an additional 5 minutes.
8. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan.
